sentences.sContent: David bent down to tie his shoelace.
Tears were streaming down my face.
The sun was going down and it would soon be dark.
sentences.sCn: 夕阳西下，天很快就要黑了。

sentences.sContent: They came running down the stairs.
She stood on a balcony looking down into the courtyard.
sentences.sCn: 她站在阳台上朝下面的院子望去。

sentences.sContent: Glancing down the list of runners, I noticed a familiar name.
sentences.sCn: 我往下扫了一眼赛跑选手的名单，注意到了一个熟悉的名字。

sentences.sContent: Her hair came down to her waist.
sentences.sCn: 她的头发一直垂到腰际。

sentences.sContent: Ken fell asleep face down (= with his face towards the ground ) on the couch.
sentences.sCn: 肯趴在长沙发上睡着了。

synos.tran: 软毛，[植]绒毛；[地质]开阔的高地

phrases.pCn: 下降；平静下来；传下去；被接受
彻底地，完全；在一切方面
贫困潦倒的；被击倒不能再战的
(股票市场上) 与…相比下跌
[澳大利亚、新西兰英语](尤指在不需要的时候或抢在别人前面)获得某物
等到最后一刻才开始做事，最后关头
把某人请来作客(从城市到农村，从河流上游到下游，从北到南等用 down，反之 用 up)

words.tran: 柔和的；绒毛的；多丘岗的

trans.tranOther: to or towards a lower place or position

trans.tranCn: 软毛，绒毛；[地质] 开阔的高地

trans.tranOther: used to say that you strongly oppose a government, leader etc and want them to lose their power
